required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Body Mass Index on Serum Maternal and Fetal Magnesium Level
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Body Mass Index on Serum Maternal and Fetal Magnesium Level in Pregnant Recipients of Magnesium Sulphate

brief_summary.textblock: Magnesium sulphate is an inorganic salt with multiple therapeutic applications in medicine it has been widely utilized and studied on a diverse set of conditions such as asthma, cardiac arrhythmia and stroke. In pregnant women ,MgSo4 has been used in many cases such as for seizures prophylaxis in preeclampsia, tocolysis in preterm labour and for fetal neuroprotection in immenint preterm delivery.MgSo4 has been used as the standard drug for tocolysis in preterm labour and other drugs have been compared to it.

primary_outcome.measure: the percentage of women reaching the Mg therapeutic level.
primary_outcome.description: the Mg therapeutic level of 4,8 mg/dl.

arm_group.description: pregnant women admitted to Women's Health Hospital , Assiut university during 2019-2020 will be counseled to participate in the study

intervention.description: 4 gram MgSo4 diluted in 150 cc saline infused IV within 30 minutes as loading dose then the patient will receive the maintenance dose of 1gram MgSo4 per hour for 6 hours.

study_pop.textblock:
women included will be classified according to BMI underwieght ( less than 18.85) , Normal weight (18.5-24.9)
, Overweight (25-29.9) and obese (30 or more)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
pregnant women 34 weeks or less admitted to Women's Health Hospital with a diagnosis of :
- sever preeclampsia. It is defined as 1- blood pressure 160/110 mmHg or more 2- proteinurea (+3 or more by dipstick) 3-HELLP syndrome
- threatened preterm labour that will receive Magnesium Sulphate either for tocolysis or neuroprotection.
Exclusion criteria:
- women with more than 34 weeks gestation and with any contraindication for Magnesium Sulphate intake like severe renal impairment or myasthenia gravis.
